wikipedia_page.main: Albert Edward Mark Whittle (16 September 1877 – 18 March 1917) was a first-class cricketer who played for Warwickshire and Somerset. He was born in Bristol and died at Charminster, Dorset. Whittle was a useful right-handed batsman the bulk of whose cricket career was spent batting low in the order; he was also a right-arm medium-paced bowler.
